Class BCLReaderView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.bluefire.bclreader.publicclasses.BCLReaderView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, org.readium.sdk.android.SdkErrorHandler

    public class BCLReaderView
extends android.view.ViewGroup
implements org.readium.sdk.android.SdkErrorHandler
    Custom view that renders an ePub within a WebView.

      • addHighlightForCurrentLocation

        public BCLHighlight addHighlightForCurrentLocation()
        Adds a highlight based on the current location. The highlight will have a location with no range, so it will not render with a highlighted effect. The advantage of calling this method over the getLocation method is that highlights have a unique ID within a book, which is useful when persisting highlights for a feature like bookmarks or annotations.
        Returns:
        A BCLHighlight or null if the highlight was unable to be created.

      • addHighlightForCurrentSelection

        public void addHighlightForCurrentSelection()
        Adds a highlight based on the current text selection. If successful, the listener assigned with setOnHighlightDidCompleteListener will be called with a BCLHighlight object.

      • goToLocation

        public void goToLocation(BCLLocation location,
                         boolean isHighlighted)
        Causes the reader view to jump to the given location. When navigating to a search result, it can be useful to highlight its location to show the result within the context of the book. When isHighlighted is enabled, the highlight renders only temporarily, clearing itself automatically. Note that to go to a location which is a percentage of the way through the book, simply call getPageListItems() which will return an array of all pages in the book. At this point you may select a page list item from the array which is the percentage of the way through the array, and navigate to the CFI contained within that page list item.
        Parameters:
        location - The destination location.
        isHighlighted - Whether or not to temporarily highlight the location.
